keywords.value: Al Qaeda in the Arabian Peninsula
keywords.name: organizations

byline.original: By SAEED AL-BATATI, KAREEM FAHIM and ERIC SCHMITT
byline.contributor: Saeed Al-Batati reported from Al Mukalla, Kareem Fahim from Cairo, and Eric Schmitt from Washington. Mark Mazzetti contributed reporting from Washington, and Nour Youssef from Cairo.

lead_paragraph: The loss of Al Mukalla was a blow to Al Qaeda’s Yemeni branch, which had controlled the southern city for more than a year and used it as a base.

headline.print_headline: Yemeni Troops, Backed by Emiratis, Take Key City From Qaeda Militants
headline.main: Yemeni Troops, Backed by United Arab Emirates, Take City From Al Qaeda

snippet: The loss of Al Mukalla was a blow to Al Qaeda’s Yemeni branch, which had controlled the southern city for more than a year and used it as a base.
abstract: Yemeni troops retake city of Al Mukalla from Al Qaeda in the Arabian Peninsula with little combat; loss of city is setback to militant group's Yemeni branch, considered most dangerous affiliate.
